III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A received injuries to his face and lip and was slammed to
the ground by staff during a restraint attempt.
Investigation The Program Supervisor was interviewed during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on 04/30/2024. The
Program Supervisor reviewed the allegations that were received
regarding Youth A and documentation was provided. The
Program Supervisor stated both instances of restraints of Youth A
on 04/18/2024 occurred in areas that were not covered by video
footage.
Nurse 1 was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit at the facility on 04/30/2024. She stated she made contact
with Youth A on 04/18/2024. Nurse 1 stated she saw Youth A
later in the evening, around 9:00pm. She was called over to
assess Youth A because staff had reported he was exhibiting
seizure-like symptoms. At that time, he was outside of one of the
buildings sitting on the steps. Nurse 1 recalled Youth A was alert
and did not show any seizure-like symptoms when she arrived.
He was very upset but was not escalated or combative towards
any other staff at this point. She recalled he came with her and
she drove him back to his unit. Nurse 1 dropped him off and
2

departed and she noted she was then called back to the unit
about a half hour later. She encountered Youth A, who stated his
arm was hurting after being restrained. Nurse 1 recalled
assessing that there was no likely injury to Youth A at that time,
including looking at his knee that he later stated hurt as well.
Nurse 2 was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit at the facility on 04/30/2024. She recalled interacting with
Youth A on 04/30/2024 prior to Nurse 1’s interactions. Nurse 2
recalled witnessing Youth A punch himself in the face repeatedly,
and he would stop for a minute and then start again. Nurse 2
stated Youth A stopped punching himself after he was restrained
by staff, which she did not fully witness. She recalled him stating
his left arm hurt, but her assessment was that there were no
obvious injuries because his movement of his arm was
unencumbered.
Youth A was interviewed during an unannounced, face-to-face
visit at the facility on 04/30/2024. Youth A stated he has often
made himself bleed by punching himself in the face during times
when he was upset. Youth A had difficulty recalling the incident in
question. He stated he felt like Staff 1 was involved and that he
threw Youth A to the ground during an attempted restraint. Youth
A also stated Staff 1 spit on him during this incident. Youth A
could not recall if this occurred outside on the steps of a building
or in his unit. Youth A believed there were no other youth that
witnessed any part of this incident because of where it occurred.
Youth A believed he saw nursing staff after being restrained but
was not sure if they were helpful or not. He stated there had not
been any recent incidents that caused him arm or knee pain.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 05/23/2024. He
recalled being involved in the later instance of restraint on
04/18/2024 with Youth A. Staff 1 recalled Youth A escalating
while in his room and then barricading himself in a bathroom stall.
As he came out of the stall, Youth A spit at and charged at Staff 1
and Staff 4. Staff 1 stated a standing high hold restraint was
initiated and this transitioned to a team control hold as Youth A
dropped his weight to the ground. Staff 1 stated Youth A fell
forward to his chest and he was immediately rolled over to his
back. Staff 1 recalled Youth A being restrained in a supine
position for 7-10 minutes, Staff 1 stated Youth A then committed
to safety and was able to be released. After this occurred Staff 1
recalled Youth A punched himself in the face several times. This
occurred at the same time as nursing staff arrived at the unit.
Staff 1 recalled Youth A then being treated for a bloody lip. Staff 1
3

denied ever throwing Youth A to the ground, as well as denied
ever spitting at Youth A.
Youth A’s facility Case Manager was interviewed over the phone
on 05/30/2024. The Case Manager stated she was not involved
with Youth A on the date of 04/18/2024 but did meet with him days
later in an effort to debrief the incidents. During this meeting
Youth A stated a staff member had thrown him to the ground
during the incidents and this was how he injured his lip, possibly
causing a tooth to be knocked loose.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 05/30/2024. He stated
he was involved in the incidents involving Youth A on 04/18/2024.
Staff 1 recalled Youth A leaving the building he was in and
proceeding to pick up sticks and rocks and throw them at cars in
the parking lot, and then at any staff that approached him. Staff 2
stated he participated in a standing hold restraint as this escalated
in an attempt to keep Youth A from damaging cars or hitting and
injuring staff. Staff 2 stated Youth A went to the ground on his
own power and ended up in a seated position on some exterior
stairs to the building. Staff 2 stated this all ended with a supine
restraint, and shortly after that occurred, Youth A was calm and
was able to get up. Staff 2 recalled offering Youth A, a ride back
to his unit at that time. After this occurred Youth A began to
punch himself in the head and face. Staff 2 recalled attempting to
restrain his arms at this point to stop him from injuring himself and
described the hold as loose. Staff 2 recalled Youth A beginning to
bleed and he spit blood toward Staff 2. Staff 2 believed he
disengaged from Youth A at this point and recalled he began to
calm down at this time. Staff 2 recalled nursing staff being called
over because Youth A appeared to show seizure-like symptoms,
but that did not last long, and the nursing staff arrived quickly.
Staff 2 did not believe there was ever a point where his contact
with Youth A would have caused the injury to his lip, and that was
directly caused by Youth A punching himself in the mouth.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024. Staff 4
stated he was involved in restraint attempts with Youth A on the
date in question, one being outside a building and one inside the
unit. Staff 4 recalled Youth A struggling significantly, but the
restraints themselves were performed adequately in order to keep
Youth A safe. Staff 4 stated the main thing he remembered was
Youth A was repeatedly trying to punch himself in the face and
this caused him to get bloody lips. Staff 4 did not recall if Youth A
was saying much as this occurred. Staff 4 stated he did not see
4

anyone hit Youth A or slam him to the ground during these
incidents.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone on 06/06/2024. Staff 5
recalled the incidents in question. He noted Youth A was
punching himself in the face on the date of 04/18/2024 and this
occurs often. Staff 5 stated it is common for staff to attempt to
restrain Youth A as he is doing this so that he does not injure
himself, and often times Youth A will stop punching himself as
they make this attempt. Staff 5 stated there were no actions on
the part of staff that would have caused injury to Youth A on this
date, whether that occurred when he was in the unit or when he
was outside the unit attempting to throw rocks at staff and their
cars.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report documentation dated 04/18/2024 and
authored separately by Staff 1 and Staff 4 was provided
and reviewed. This documentation provided consistent
details of Youth A’s escalation and staff’s response from
that date.
• Nursing notes authored by Nurse 1 and Nurse 2 covering
interactions with Youth A over the course of the day on
04/18/2024 were provided and reviewed. This
documentation was consistent with details provided by
these two staff members.
• Policy & procedures from the facility titled “Emergency
Restraint” and last updated 07/18/2022 were provided and
reviewed. Procedures for the use of the chosen restraint
model of CPI were consistent with the details provided in
interviews with staff.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there was not evidence
found to show that Youth A was injured as a result of any staff
involvement during incidents.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
